column4: i want to split HD partititon(resize and create new one),should i do it with gparted or within windows?which one is better?
then when i reboot to windows,will it recognize the new partition?
get the gparted linux livecd, download the iso and burn it to a cd, boot with that and set up your partitions from there.
after their set up with that restart the system and boot into the ubuntu installer with your ubuntu cd
i have gparted installed, why should i use live cd? is there any other differeneces?
because you can setup the partitions outside of the ubuntu install cd
if you are runing ubuntu why do you need to partition?
i ve 3 parttion windows,data,ubuntu, i want to split data into data and mac,because i will install mac on it

I never set up my partitions within linux, I like control over how their set up, I like to low level format, check for errors, setup separate partitions not outside of linux in case i run into error,etc.., but thats me.

you do a rescue in recovery mode, use fsck
